message: Question to fellow geeks. Does anyone actually enjoy writing Javascript ? or is it just something you do because you have to, to make a living in web dev?

data.message: coding any language is fun ya samy

I never have fun in Javascript ya Shalablab , I don't know if someone "3amaly 3amal" ? But I have an extreme loathing and refusal to write code in this language. Python is on the contrary, I love it and can never get enough of it. ASP classic was the same, I am trying to understand this.

Even thought i'm a PHP developer. I really love JS, I just wait from time to time to have a chance to program with it. Also studying the internals of it is so much fun and pleasure for me. I'm in love ! :D
Try to read more about functional programming paradigm and you will understand more about the nature of these languages.

status = (javascript && enjoy) ? "don't mix !" : "just do your job !" ;
console.log(status);

Ahmed Shalaby
> console.log(status)
undefined

yes, it's usually "undefined" :D
just set the boolean values of the 2 variables and it will run

أنا مابحبهاش كلغة، بالإضافة إلى إني باكرهها علشان لأننا كبشر معترفين إن مش دي أفضل لغة عملناها لكن مضطرين نستخدمها علشان أهو اللي حصل بقى والتوافق اللي حصل عليها اللي أغلبه تم لاشعوريا والخ، وده بيذكرني بمأساتنا الأزلية
The same feeling it is a horrible language

I enjoy js, specially in the server side "node js"
Being able to write a script and run it just write now on the already opened browser's console is lovely
There was a time when you had to insert 8-bit opcodes byte by byte to formulate basic functions even with absence of a working assembler.. We owe a lot to interpreted languages.. Cherish JS !

People always mix between JavaScript the language and the DOM. A lot of the hate originally is caused by the horrible implementation of the DOM which really is browsers vendors' fault.
JavaScript was written and shipped in 10 days. A lot of the bad parts in it is left for backward compatibility (like the only object in JavaScript that evaluates to false ... Something very similar to the reason why Microsoft named the new Windows 10 instead of 9 )
When you spend long time with JavaScript you begin to understand how it works and you will begin to feel its beauty.

Mohammad Tayseer Ahmed Shalaby
it actually return undefined because the log function returns nothing :D

لغة إتعملت في 5 أيام أو 10 أيام مافهاش جمال، "ده توحد مع المعتدي" :D حبّها علشان تعرف تكتب كود بها.. شوف الـ bugs اللي فيها على إنها features والخ ، هي حلوه بس أنا كنت شايفها من زاوية غلط أو وهي صاحيه من النوم

Ahmad Alfy In Chrome console & Node, the result is

> console.log('11')
11
undefined

In FF
> console.log('11')
undefined
11

So, it's implementation dependent!

Guys, I like Python cause the language itself has very nice and clean syntax, I like the indentations instead of curly braces, being a big fan of VB and also no more ";". The thing I hate about JS is it looks like C# and Java but it isn't. It also has very bad autocomplete and debugging and I hate being tied to a browser to test my code. Sometimes it is nice just to write some server side code or maybe some algorithms or even in Python a Tkinter application which is like a windows application. Also Python can be used for scripting and access the file system. JS on the other hands just does access to HTML elements and the syntax is never really that readable to me, whereas in Python I can read what the program is doing and understand. I can easily download Pycharm or Eric or even some Emacs mods and work on Python with great Autocomplete and debugging. I don't know how I can do that in JS, Also, even the JS frameworks you guys mention are mainly UI manipulation and I don't really get a buzz out of that,

بأقولك إيه... الجافاسكربت دي كويسة .. بس كده :) .... لا فعلا ، ادخل شوية على nodejs وشوف الليلة الكبيرة اللي عاملاها ، سرعة في عمل برامج كبيرة أو صغيرة ، ببساطة وخفة تجعلك تدمنها ، مش لازم تكون مطور ويب ، يكفي أن تكون مطورا .... أظن ان هناك شيئا لا يستغنى عنه المطور وهو automation ، وأعتقد ان حبك لل Python لأنها مفيدة جدا في ال automation ... جرب دخول الباب على الجافاسكربت بس على node هتعرف كيف هي جميلة ومرنة  ...  اقرأ عن Grunt أو Gulp  في ال automation ، انسى ال UI تماما .. اللغة دي بتعمل كل حاجة ، أنا عملت cross platform media player   في نصف ساعة، بأقل من 70 سطر كود ، شوف انت بقى
i hate js Complexity
انتوا اكيد بتهزروا js is one of the most used programming language and soon it will make a revolution in the backend "nodejs" as well as frontend
Fady Samir My question is not whether or not it is popular, which it undeniably is, the issue is whether or not you like writing JS code?
Languages are like tools , you love them when they get the job done .

Actually, you don't just take caffiene tablets to wake up, you get yourself a good coffee bean and a good coffee maker and make yourself a cup of heaven. If it were getting the job done, we'd all just be sniffing nescafe powder :)
Sure I enjoy js, I always feel job is done when it comes to js :)
I really Love writing Javascript :)
You have to use JS in real application to love it ,. it's the web swiss army knife
